item.title: Opinion: A new statue for an old tyrant
item.description: Soviet leader Josef Stalin's legacy includes mass purges and executions. Statues of him in Russia came down decades ago, but in recent years new statues have cropped up, including one this week.

item.title: A disabled mom's message to parents: We all need help, and it's OK to ask for it
item.description: Raising two kids while living with an autonomic nervous system disorder taught Jessica Slice to embrace interdependence. Her story is a reminder to parents of the power of asking for help.

item.title: Trump pardons drug kingpins even as he escalates U.S. drug war rhetoric
item.description: President Trump has promised to attack drug gangs and called for the death penalty for street dealers. But he has also pardoned more than 20 people serving time for serious drug crimes, some involving violence.

item.description: The White House said it's reached deals with nine law firms to provide about $1 billion in pro bono services. But the details of those agreements remain murky.

item.title: Meta plans to replace humans with AI to assess privacy and societal risks
item.description: Current and former Meta employees fear the new automation push comes at the cost of allowing AI to make tricky determinations about how Meta's apps could lead to real world harm.

item.title: Memory cafes offer camaraderie and fun for people with dementia — and their caregivers
item.description: 'Memory cafes' are small social gatherings for individuals with dementia — and their caregivers, too. As public health funding shrinks, memory cafes are cheap to run and can offer measurable benefits.

item.description: RFK Jr. announced this week that the federal government is removing the recommendation that kids and pregnant women get routine COVID-19 vaccines. But CDC advice is more nuanced.

item.title: Ultramarathon runner breastfeeds her baby 3 times on her way to a surprise win
item.description: The extreme sport of ultrarunning is known for seemingly impossible feats. But Stephanie Case's recent performance — six months after giving birth — is making waves far beyond the running community.

item.title: Here's the science behind the COVID vaccine in pregnancy
item.description: Existing evidence on the safety and efficacy of getting a COVID vaccine in pregnancy all points the same way: the shot is important for maternal and fetal health.
